full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 794 Filed 07/23/25 Page 3 of 3
Fed. Grand Jury Procs., 760 F.2d 436, 439 (2d Cir. 1985) (“Recognizing the importance of secrecy to the proper functioning of the grand jury system, the Supreme Court has established a strict test of particularized need[.]”); United States v. Sobotka, 623 F.2d 764, 768 (2d Cir. 1980) (“[T]he showing of need [for grand jury materials] must be made ‘with particularity’ so that ‘the secrecy of the proceedings (may be) lifted discretely and limitedly.”) (quoting Procter & Gamble Co., 356 U.S. at 682–83)); United States v. Laster, 313 F. App’x 369, 371 (2d Cir. 2009) (similar).
SO ORDERED.
Dated: July 23, 2025 New York, New York
PAUL A. ENGELMAYER United States District Judge
